programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes led the Kansas City Chiefs to a 38-35 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles with two fourth-quarter touchdown passes and a decisive 26-yard scramble. The Chiefs won their second NFL title in four years and two-time NFL MVP Mahomes earned his second Super Bowl MVP award.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: From Feb. 9, 2025.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: DeMarvion Overshown's dynamic pick-6 from 23 yards put Dallas in front for good, Rico Dowdle ran for a score in his first career 100-yard game and the Cowboys held on for a 27-20 Thanksgiving Day victory over the New York Giants.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: Relive all the best sights and sounds from Super Bowl LVII. A recap of Super Bowl LVII between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 32 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! We are ON SITE at Subaru Park in Philly to recap the PLL semis. programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.desc: Some of the best moments of in sports talk on Fubo Sports Network.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Two first-time female fighters knuckle up with Khortni Kamyron vs. Gabrielle Roman, then Marcus Edwards fights Action Jackson, and Mathew Maestas fights Dillon Winemiller in a crowd thriller.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Exceptional bare knuckle fights between Keith Richardson and Cody Jenkins, Doug Coltrane vs. Blake Lacaze, and finishes off with a battle between Tony 'Loco' Soto vs. Tyler Goodjohn.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: The best of bare knuckle fighting featuring Dustin Pague vs. Wade Johnson, Brandon Bushaw vs. Rick Caruso, Trevor Loken vs. Brandon Allen and finshes off with Trukon Carson vs. LJ Hermrick.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A collection of battles featuring Jimmie Rivera vs. Tajikistan's Bekhzod Usmonov, Dakota Cochrane vs. Noah Cutter, and finishes things off with Houston 'The Asassin' Alexander vs. Jeremy Smith.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: This episode of Knuckle Up brings the heat with DAWID OSKAR throwing down against STANOI TABAKOV in a fierce main event, DEC SPELMAN colliding with TOMAS LEJSEK in a clash of heavy hitters, MATT HODGSON battling DANNY MOIR in a gritty war, and GAZ CORRAN facing DAWID CHYLINSKI in a fight fans won't forget.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Carlos Trinidad-Snake battles Elvin Brito, followed by Alonzo Martinez vs. Jeremy Sauceda in an epic battle, and wraps up with Sean Wilson vs. Brandon Meyer in a crazy knucklefest.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: An exciting bare knuckle fight between Jeff Souder and Idrees Wasi opens up the show followed by Jake Masson-Wong vs Taylor Starling, and Ryan Braun challenges Andrew Potter.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Featuring Bryce Henry vs. Billy Wagner, Lloyd Mix trades hands with Dallas Davidson, and the first ever BKFC featherweight title fight pits Kai Stewart against Louie Lopez.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Fan favorite Leo Bercier opens the show against Willie Sears, followed by Dorian Long against Mark Johnson, Jordan Christensen vs. Kerry Lattimer, and Sawyer Depee takes on Gabriel Mota.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Two first-time female fighters knuckle up with Khortni Kamyron vs. Gabrielle Roman, then Marcus Edwards fights Action Jackson, and Mathew Maestas fights Dillon Winemiller in a crowd thriller.

Filmed live at the UCB theater in Hollywood.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the final challenge in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the Top Two home cooks will have one last chance to prove to the judges that they deserve the MASTERCHEF title by creating a three-course meal.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Judging the battle rounds will be Ramsay and Tosi, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. In order to move to the next round of the competition, the home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The race to be the next MASTERCHEF JUNIOR shifts into full gear as the Top Eight pair up in the most intense mystery box challenge of the season, in which the chef-testants are challenged to pull off something highly creative and seriously delicious with corn. Only one will win a game-changing advantage that is certain to cause a ruckus in the tapas-themed, tag-team challenge. The best junior home cooks in America are put to the test.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top Six junior home cooks tackle the most daunting challenge in MASTERCHEF JUNIOR history when they take over Michelin Star Los Angeles restaurant Mélisse. To rise to the occasion, the teams face an intense environment, hungry guests with high expectations and the wrath of Gordon Ramsay. Find out which team makes it straight into the semifinal and which team will be sent into eliminations.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s last mystery box challenge, the remaining contestants receive a surprise taste from home when they are tasked with creating a dish inspired by family. Whoever wins this challenge will immediately earn a spot in the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR finale. Then, in a juicy elimination test, the chef-testant who elevates a secret ingredient with the most finesse and personality will secure his or her spot in the finale. See how far the junior home cooks have come.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in this exciting two-hour finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but now only three young chef-testants remain standing. The challenges this year were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch as the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Long Beach, California to visit Nino's Italian Restaurant, where ownership has changed hands from a pleasant immigrant couple to their obnoxious son.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In Norwalk, Ohio, Chef Ramsay encounters the inflexible owner of Mill Street Bistro.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: It's down to the top ten! Chef Ramsay surprises the chefs with carnival games for their next challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay and actor Danny Trejo challenge the chefs to a taco competition.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In a continuation of the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America compete head-to-head in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt the to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title. The remaining home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals and make the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After the Battle of the Apron concludes, the Top 20 home cooks in America meet the first guest judge of the season – culinary icon Wolfgang Puck, who will introduce the season’s first Mystery Box Challenge. Each contestant will have 60 minutes to create a dish of their choice that features one of the world’s most fundamental ingredients – potatoes! The winner of the Mystery Box Challenge is rewarded with a significant decision going into the season’s first elimination challenge, during which they will have to replicate one of Chef Ramsay’s signature dishes in less than 60 minutes.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty continues his revamp of the dry garden, repots succulents and plants up a window box, while Frances Tophill visits a north London garden which has sustainable produce at its core.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants tender perennials, including salvias and gingers, in the Jewel Garden, brings his citrus plants out from their winter protection and plants primulas in his new bog garden. As tulip season reaches its glorious peak, Rachel de Thame visits a dazzling display of this spring favourite at a garden in Gloucestershire, and Joe Swift checks out a pub garden with a difference in East Sussex.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Adam Frost and Arit Anderson reveal the highlights of the show gardens and this year's must-have flowers and plants on display in the Floral Marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There's been a huge surge of interest in houseplants, so Frances Tophill and Nick Bailey celebrate the joys of indoor gardening from Oxford Botanic Garden. Rachel de Thame visits a nursery in Devon who specialise in growing orchids.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows the range of vegetables that can be easily grown in containers if you are short on space, moves ornamental grasses and sows zinnias. Nick Bailey gives us an insight into the bearded iris in Buckinghamshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whether there is a heatwave or a downpour, Monty has plenty of jobs to be getting on with from pruning, propagating or planting pots. Adam Frost meets Prince Charles in his garden at Highgrove to talk about the issue of biosecurity, an issue which is of great concern to him and which could have a big effect on our gardens and landscape. Adam also talks to The Prince's Head Forester to find out what gardeners can do to help.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Nicky Buckley winds up our Christmas Markets cruise in Europe, enjoying all the festive favorites through Germany and into Amsterdam.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan's road trip continues in Illinois. The guys head to the legendary Grigsby Farm. After multiple encounters with a big deer, Jordan is finally able to put a great buck on the ground

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is in Stuart, FL. Joined by 16-year-old angler, Denton Potter. The two are targeting the local bridge dwelling giants, while going “Beyond The Surface” into Denton’s story.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger join Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for some hot Red Snapper action.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger launch from the incomparable Oceans Edge Resort in Key West, Florida to hunt down all kinds of sport fish.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike hunts For Big Snook On the East Coast.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: When Blair heads down to Louisiana to fish, it's usually with Capt. Mike Frenette and it's usually for big redfish.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's next adventure takes him west to Nevada for a giant bull elk with an early rifle elk tag in his pocket. As a non-resident, Mark had less than a 1% chance to draw this tag with Worldwide Trophy Adventures (WTA) TAGS Program. This is why he loves the tag system, you never know when you're going to get a tag. This area provides one of the best elk tags in the state of Nevada. Mark is bringing his brand new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle to the high mountains of the Nevada desert.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Jack Given & The Fish For Holly Crew Championship Style!

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Charlie Scoble & Donnie Lang on a mother ship trip aboard the “TACKLE CENTER” to the Dry Tortugas

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What fish can you chase 365 days a year in almost any weather conditions in deep, shallow, skinny, stained or crystal clear water with a variety of baits and tactics? Justin & Travis illustrate how the Redfish is the go to sport fish that they will never get tired of chasing.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has Humminbird’s Bill Carson onboard to show him how the new CoastMaster charts look in Panama City Beach waters and find it’s not just red snapper that populate these waters. It’s a smorgasbord of snapper for the cooler.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma getting the Oklahoma turkey season kicked off.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy is at the Raven in Missouri trying to take advantage of some dry weather and get some Big Tine borderline planted and check off a long list of other summer time prep work as opening day of deer season will be here before we know it.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the dirty bird in Oklahoma kicking off the second day of bow season. Randy is already tagged out on a dandy of an 8 point we showed you last season in the “Camp Buck episode”. Joe Umphries from Big Tine is in camp and he is trying to close the deal on a buck he had a close call with last season at the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy has been playing cat and mouse with a buck called “The Kansas 8” and after 2 encounters he is trying to seal the coffin on this big Missouri whitetail once and for all.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s still opening week of bow season in Oklahoma and the crew has three tags left to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Fishing with the Mayor Description: Join the Major of destin as he ventures into the world of coastal fishing, leaving the city behind for a day of fun and unexpected challenges. With plenty of laughs and surprising twists, this episode showcases the Mayor in a whole new light.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Pursued with near maniacal passion, Nick dives into the serious cult of blackfishing joined by local salts Captain Sean Reilly and Capt. Sam Rescigno on the Mary M IV.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground with Nick Honachefsky
programme.desc: Nick joins local colorful characters Dave Showell and Brian Donohue to target back bay white perch and to rake fresh cherrystone clams in the backyard of the infamous Jersey Devil.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This episode is all about thanking our service men and women who have served or are still currently serving; Our pals Wes Thomas and Terry McWilliams join in to help thank these heroes, along with great companies like IN 811 and Centerpoint; special thanks to West Bogg Park for having us again this year.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we join professional angler, Andrew Nordbye, for a cold day on Guntersville to catch some giant crappie; traveling through a major winter storm and arriving at an abandoned lake was the not-surprising scene for the day. Andrew's priorities are in order when it comes to his marriage, his faith, and his family, including just-arrived new babies...but he sill made time to squeeze in this day on water with us!

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week, we reflect on a tragic and sad memory in our lives as we remember a dear childhood friend of my son Nick, Nathan Wimsatt. Our families have been close for man years and shared a lot of time together around the soccer field, vacations, fishing trips, and much more. Nathan passed in a tragic car accident at only 18 years on April 29th, 2023. This week his Dad Brian is joining me on Lake Taylorsville where we'll share some memories and celebrate Nathan's life...that ended way to soon!

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we're joined by our good friend and Worship Leader, Rob Key. A tremendous musical talent that's chased the country music dream, but found his calling as worship leader at Taylorsville Community Church. Rob's love for serving the Lord is his top priority, but he certainly enjoys the great outdoors and especially doing a little fishing.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali & Rush look back on the adventures of the year and revisit the concept behind Local Knowledge.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by MMA fighter Clay Guide for the exciting variety of Barracuda, Sharks and Jacks in the Middle Keys Channel Flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young guide Richard Black as he leads them to a backcountry slam.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young up and coming guide Anthony Vargas, who puts them on a wide variety of game fish in the Keys backcountry.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie, a talented guide with a special knack for finding permit on the Key West flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by New York Cop Mike Counihan, who brings his passion for fitness and fishing along as the crew take on sharks in the Middle Florida Keys flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Polaris
programme.desc: Host Alexa Score is in California for Project X with Rugged Radios.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Nicky Buckley winds up our Christmas Markets cruise in Europe, enjoying all the festive favorites through Germany and into Amsterdam.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan's road trip continues in Illinois. The guys head to the legendary Grigsby Farm. After multiple encounters with a big deer, Jordan is finally able to put a great buck on the ground

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Today, Capt. Danny is in Stuart, FL. Joined by 16-year-old angler, Denton Potter. The two are targeting the local bridge dwelling giants, while going “Beyond The Surface” into Denton’s story.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger join Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for some hot Red Snapper action.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger launch from the incomparable Oceans Edge Resort in Key West, Florida to hunt down all kinds of sport fish.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike hunts For Big Snook On the East Coast.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: When Blair heads down to Louisiana to fish, it's usually with Capt. Mike Frenette and it's usually for big redfish.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's next adventure takes him west to Nevada for a giant bull elk with an early rifle elk tag in his pocket. As a non-resident, Mark had less than a 1% chance to draw this tag with Worldwide Trophy Adventures (WTA) TAGS Program. This is why he loves the tag system, you never know when you're going to get a tag. This area provides one of the best elk tags in the state of Nevada. Mark is bringing his brand new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle to the high mountains of the Nevada desert.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Jack Given & The Fish For Holly Crew Championship Style!

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Charlie Scoble & Donnie Lang on a mother ship trip aboard the “TACKLE CENTER” to the Dry Tortugas

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s no secret that sight fishing clear emerald green water is a favorite of local anglers when conditions are perfect. But perfection is rare. Justin & Travis share methods and techniques for finding and catching fish when the conditions are less than perfect on the beach and in the bay.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: What fish can you chase 365 days a year in almost any weather conditions in deep, shallow, skinny, stained or crystal clear water with a variety of baits and tactics? Justin & Travis illustrate how the Redfish is the go to sport fish that they will never get tired of chasing.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has Humminbird’s Bill Carson onboard to show him how the new CoastMaster charts look in Panama City Beach waters and find it’s not just red snapper that populate these waters. It’s a smorgasbord of snapper for the cooler.

programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma getting the Oklahoma turkey season kicked off.

After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: The Texan Meets Calamity Jane

When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Nevadan

programme.title: The Hellions

programme.title: Arizona

Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. programme.desc: While investigating a kidnapping and murder, the team finds a safe with dozens of pictures of missing women; as the team tries to find Boa Vista's kidnapped sister, Horatio must find the killer.

programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead with his wrists slashed and suspicion turns towards a spiritualist church.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: DCI Barnaby and Sgt. Scott investigate the death of John Ransom in the village of Midsomer Mere. He had just been ejected from a pub for fighting but the post mortem shows a series of burn marks on his skull indicating he may have been subject to electric shock.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.desc: The auction blocks see a diverse range of collector trucks, including Toyota Landcruisers, Chevy C10s, a GMC C10 and an F-150 SVT Raptor.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson is five decades strong and ready to celebrate with an out of this world 50th anniversary auction celebration in Scottsdale, Ariz.; the block heats up as unbelievable cars make their auction debut.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Big bucks for Broncos and Mustangs as cowboys and cowgirls go head-to-head wrangling some of the best deals at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: It's Ford versus Ferrari and Corvettes versus Chevelles as the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions continue to break records selling incredible vehicles in beautiful Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Among a bevy of beautiful vehicles being auctioned at no reserve are Simon Cowell's 1970 Triumph Spitfire MK III Convertible and John Mayer's 2006 Ford GT Heritage Edition!

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl relies on the experience of veteran cutters Dwayne and Chuck to take down massive old-growth trees; Craig Rygaard discovers son Jason made a catastrophic and costly miscalculation; Frank Harkness races to transport $100,000 worth of logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, a family emergency takes Mark from the yarder seat with no time for a shutdown.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Pihl looks for help from a logging legend; Jason Rygaard faces his biggest test as the new boss; the Harkness crew battles winter storms and vertical terrain in the Cascade Mountains; Wade Etienne goes after valuable hardwood giants.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brandon Harkness fights his way up a mountainside; Mike Pihl get his 52-ton yarder lodged between trees; Wade Ettiene's Big Mama takes a two-inch steel sawtooth to her face; and Buckin' Billy's son Hogan loses his grip while cutting a tree.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl gambles on horsepower.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging fights to fix a crooked skyline, crossing a deep valley on their longest road yet.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A breakdown forces Jason Rygaard to choose between his crew's safety and finishing the job; Frank Harkness is caught in a whiteout while moving the excavator on a narrow mountainside logging road.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny feels nostalgic in Koreatown, so he brings along an old friend, which may or may not be a good idea; Brandi and Jarrod sweeten their profit in an unexpected way; Ivy tolerates the big city in an effort to find some name-brand goodies.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Emily brings her mother along; Darrell wastes no time finding an advantage; Ivy and Ivy Jr. clean up with their locker; Kenny gets some advice from a music legend; Shana and Edwina settle for thrifting what's in front of them.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Hesperia, Calif., Mary's transportation troubles lead to her teaming up with Kenny and taking him out to pasture; Darrell shows the next generation of Gambler how it's done; the Vegas Ladies' mid-century style lets them write their own ticket.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: It's all in the family in Moreno Valley, Calif., as Emily brings along her cowboy husband; Ivy is displeased at Mary's fraternization with the auctioneer; Kenny looks for anything in his locker that can wash off that storage scent.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has a completely groovy time in Van Nuys, Calif.; Ivy starts his day off with an unwelcome bang; Brandi and Jarrod are left wondering whether their unit will bring clear skies or clouds ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Winds in excess of 30 mph batter Desert Hot Springs, Calif., and the buyers do their best to keep standing; Rene and Gunther dust off an old locker; Brandi and Jarrod's unit takes a turn and ends up lapping the competition; Kenny steps up his game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy brings his son to Moreno Valley, where good things always happen, and leaves with yo-yo's of an unexpected kind; Rene and Casey discover that their shoes are more "air" and less "Jordan."

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny treats Perris, Calif., like a European vacation, picking up women along the way; Jarrod's lousy locker doesn't offer him any protection; Rene's tools end up being older than he expects.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The gang is on final approach in Riverside; Darrell listens to his sports sense, and it pays off; Ivy and Ivy get distracted by a decoy but manage to find the bills in the end; Brandi tries to teach Danielle a lesson about the true meaning of trash.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A confident Kenny has a three-step plan for success in Stanton, Calif.; Darrell helps Kimber find winning items for her new boutique; Rene brings Casey, who needs a distraction; Laura takes lead as auctioneer, while Dan holds the clipboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny's fear of sharks inspires a controversial wardrobe choice; Rene brings his bargain army along to try and intimidate the competition while he gets his slice of the loot; Darrell won't take no for an answer, moving full-steam ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Best of #6
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Research site before the ice road melts, but while scientists are on the verge of an historic breakthrough, the truckers are starting to haul away equipment piece-by-piece.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With the sun beating down on the ice, the road is melting at an accelerating rate.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Rising temperatures are melting away the ice road, making it a dash to the finish line for the crew breaking down the Langely site.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Warming temperatures are causing overflows all over the ice road, and with water rushing through cracks in the ice, hauling loads just got a lot more dangerous.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's three weeks into the winter season in Northern Alaska, and Carlile Transportation has only moved 500 of the 2,000 loads it needs to transport to the Prudhoe Bay oil fields.

programme.desc: Another winter storm drops nearly a foot of fresh, new snow, obscuring the road south.

programme.desc: The race is on to make it to Prudhoe before a wicked storm turns fierce.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
